noun.description: The branch of science concerned with the bodily structure of humans, animals, and other living organisms, especially as revealed by dissection and the separation of parts.
A study of the structure or internal workings of something.
examples: Machiavelli's anatomy of the art of war

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French anatomie or late Latin anatomia, from Greek, from ana- up + tomia cutting (from temnein to cut).
